episodes.title: The Toba Supervolcano - Humanity's Bottleneck
episodes.description: Journey to 74,000 years ago when the Toba supervolcano erupted with the force of 100,000 atomic bombs, nearly extinguishing humanity and reducing our species to perhaps 10,000 survivors scattered across a darkened, ash-covered world. Experience the ground-shaking violence as 720 cubic miles of molten rock exploded into the stratosphere, creating a volcanic winter that lasted a decade and forged the genetic bottleneck that makes every human alive today a descendant of those who refused to surrender to the earth's fury.

episodes.title: The Cretaceous Hypercane - Nature's Ultimate Storm
episodes.description: Stand witness to nature's most violent storm as the Chicxulub asteroid impact superheated the Gulf of Mexico to 125°F, spawning a hypercane with winds exceeding 600 miles per hour that scoured entire continents clean of life. Feel the air itself become a weapon as temperatures soar above 200°F and the very atmosphere transforms into a river of liquid fire, while the last dinosaurs face their final, impossible storm.

episodes.title: Titans of the Ancient Earth - When Giants Ruled
episodes.description: Breathe the oxygen-rich air of deep time and walk among giants that dwarf imagination—from the eight-foot millipede Arthropleura crawling through Carboniferous swamps to the towering Sauroposeidon reaching sixty feet into Cretaceous skies. Journey through six extraordinary epochs where life experimented with forms beyond belief: dragonflies with two-foot wingspans ruling ancient skies, saber-toothed predators stalking Permian landscapes, and the mighty Tyrannosaurus Rex standing as evolution's ultimate predator.

episodes.title: The Birth of the Moon - When Worlds Collided
episodes.description: Witness the most violent act of creation in our solar system's history as two worlds—Earth and the Mars-sized Theia—perform their final, fatal dance 4.5 billion years ago. Feel the ground literally tear apart at the atomic level as pressures exceed those at the Sun's core, watch continents of molten rock rain from space, and observe the birth of our silver companion from a disk of fire and debris.

episodes.title: Masters of Mountain Fire - The First Volcanologists
episodes.description: Descend into the molten heart of volcanic Tibet with Khyung, a Denisovan father who risks everything to harvest miracle medicines from chambers where temperatures exceed 500°F and the air itself burns. In this tale of desperate love and impossible courage, experience the sophisticated civilization of our ancient cousins who made laboratories of volcanoes and transformed Earth's most deadly forces into tools of healing.

episodes.title: When Dawn Was Young - The First Eyes to See the Sun
episodes.description: Experience the brutal reality of Paleolithic survival through the eyes of a grieving hunter who must overcome personal tragedy to lead his people through a winter that could mean extinction. Follow Norbu as he learns that leadership isn't inherited but forged, while his family faces starvation, raiders, and the harsh judgment of an unforgiving mountain landscape where every decision carries the weight of life and death.

episodes.title: The Architecture of You - Your Body's Ancient History
episodes.description: Journey through billions of years of evolution as you discover the deep history written in your very cells, from the first cooperative bacteria to the complex symphony of systems that make consciousness possible. Experience the sensory reality of each evolutionary breakthrough—feel your heart's ancient rhythm that echoes primordial oceans, breathe air perfected by countless generations of life, and understand how every emotion, breath, and heartbeat carries the memory of Earth's greatest experiments.

episodes.title: The Carboniferous Swamp Terrors - When Insects Ruled
episodes.description: Enter a world where oxygen-rich air creates monsters beyond imagination—giant millipedes eight feet long, dragonflies with three-foot wingspans, and spiders larger than dinner plates hunting in webs that span the gaps between ancient trees. Experience the hyperoxic atmosphere that transforms familiar arthropods into terrifying giants, where every breath feels like breathing liquid energy and insects become the apex predators of steaming coal swamps.

episodes.title: Breath of the High Places - Life Above the Clouds
episodes.description: Follow young Norbu as he leads his high-altitude people against desperate lowland raiders, discovering how fifty thousand years of adaptation have gifted them with blood that sings in thin air where others gasp and fail. Experience the brutal reality of survival at the roof of the world, where every breath is precious and ancient genes carry the secrets of impossible living inherited from Denisovan ancestors.

episodes.title: Earth's Epochs - A Grand Sensory Tour Through Time
episodes.description: Travel through every epoch of Earth's 4.5-billion-year history in a single sensory journey, experiencing the alien atmospheres, impossible temperatures, and evolving landscapes that transformed a molten ball of rock into the living world you know today. Feel the scorching heat of the Hadean forge, breathe the toxic gases of early atmospheres, witness the first rains falling on cooling continents, and experience the emergence of oxygen, ice ages, and the slow dance of evolution that led to consciousness itself.

episodes.title: The Permian Megadrought - When the World Dried Up
episodes.description: Witness Earth's greatest experiment in extremes as the supercontinent Pangaea creates the largest desert in planetary history, where rain becomes legend and entire species learn patience measured in geological time. Experience the suffocating heat of continental interiors where no ocean breeze can reach, where animals must choose between competing for the last water sources or dying together in dignity.

episodes.title: The First Friend - When Wolf Became Dog
episodes.description: Discover the remarkable intelligence and patience required to transform humanity's greatest competitor into its most loyal companion, as a skilled hunter named Mira recognizes opportunity where others see only threat. Experience the delicate dance of trust between human and wolf, built not on sentiment but on mutual benefit, as Sky learns to read human behavior and humans learn to interpret canine intelligence.

episodes.title: Earth's Iron Heart - The Core That Saved Life
episodes.description: Descend four thousand miles into Earth's core to witness the crystallization of iron under pressures and temperatures that exceed the surface of the sun, as liquid metal transforms into the solid heart that generates our planet's life-protecting magnetic field. Experience the impossible physics of the deep interior where matter exists in states unknown on the surface, as individual iron atoms lock into crystal lattices of mathematical perfection that span hundreds of miles.

episodes.title: Chicxulub Impact Weather - The Day the Sky Burned
episodes.description: Experience the day when weather itself became Earth's greatest killer, as a ten-mile asteroid transforms a perfect Cretaceous morning into years of atmospheric hell that will eliminate three-quarters of all life on the planet. Feel the planet's atmosphere catch fire as returning ejecta heats the air to lethal temperatures, followed by years of darkness, acid rain, and cold that freezes even the equator before giving way to a greenhouse inferno.

episodes.title: Where Rivers Meet - The Birth of Trade
episodes.description: When desperation drives innovation, intelligence finds unexpected paths to survival. Experience the profound moment when Homo erectus stands at the confluence of two rivers, watching abundance flow past while hunger threatens his family, until a radical idea transforms flowing water itself into humanity's first fishing tool. Witness the birth of environmental engineering as our ancestors learn that sometimes the greatest breakthroughs come not from fighting nature, but from making it an ally in the endless quest for survival.

episodes.title: The Cambrian Explosion
episodes.description: Journey to the Cambrian seas when life discovered the revolutionary power of sight and transformed Earth's oceans into a theater of predation, partnership, and endless innovation. Watch as simple organisms develop the first compound eyes and camera vision, as shells and armor emerge in an evolutionary arms race, and as the peaceful Ediacaran world gives way to the complex ecosystems that would define animal life forever.

episodes.title: When The Ice Wall Broke - Earth's Greatest Flood
episodes.description: Witness the most powerful flood in Earth's recent history as the massive Laurentide ice dam catastrophically fails, unleashing Lake Agassiz across North America in a deluge that carved the channeled scablands and altered global climate. Feel the ground tremble as walls of water two thousand feet high race across the landscape at eighty miles per hour, carrying house-sized boulders like pebbles and reshaping an entire continent in a matter of days.

episodes.title: The Small Fierce People - Flores Island's Hobbit Folk
episodes.description: Enter the world of Homo floresiensis on the island of Flores, where being small was not weakness but a different kind of strength in a land of giants. Follow Kira as she navigates a landscape dominated by dwarf elephants and enormous dragons, developing an unprecedented alliance between the smallest humans who ever lived and their greatest predators. This is a tale of intelligence over size, cooperation over dominance, and the remarkable adaptability that allowed these meter-tall humans to thrive in isolation until the arrival of taller cousins changed their world forever.

episodes.title: The Great Dying - Earth's Closest Call
episodes.description: Experience the Permian-Triassic extinction, the greatest catastrophe in life's history, when the Siberian Traps erupted for a million years and Earth's fever nearly extinguished complex life entirely. Journey from the lush Glossopteris forests through the purple poisoned seas to the empty wastelands where only Lystrosaurus survived, then witness the slow resurrection that would birth the age of dinosaurs.

episodes.title: When The Sky Turned To Glass - The Taupo Super-Eruption
episodes.description: Stand witness to the Taupo super-eruption 26,500 years ago, when New Zealand's peaceful lakes unleashed one of the most violent volcanic events in Earth's recent history. Feel the atmosphere itself become a weapon as microscopic glass shards rain from the sky and pyroclastic flows at 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit obliterate entire landscapes in minutes. This is the story of when air became unbreathable, when volcanic glass fell like deadly snow, and when a single eruption injected enough material into the stratosphere to alter global climate for years.

episodes.title: The Healing Touch - Medicine Before History
episodes.description: Journey to the origins of compassion and medical knowledge as early humans develop the revolutionary concept of healing others. Experience the profound moment when our ancestors first chose to care for the wounded rather than abandon them, discovering plant medicines, surgical techniques, and the healing power of touch that would define human civilization. This is the story of how empathy became evolution's greatest innovation.

episodes.title: Snowball Earth - The Frozen Planet
episodes.description: Journey to 700 million years ago when Earth transformed into a frozen sphere, wrapped in ice from pole to pole for 50 million years in the most extreme climate event in planetary history. Experience the eerie beauty of a world where purple bacterial seas lurk beneath miles of ice, where life retreats to hydrothermal vents and frozen dormancy, and where the patient accumulation of volcanic carbon dioxide finally triggers the most dramatic thaw in Earth's memory.

episodes.title: The Day The Mountains Were Born - Birth of the Appalachians
episodes.description: Travel to 485 million years ago to witness the birth of the Appalachian Mountains as the Taconic collision slowly grinds ancient seafloors into towering peaks. Feel the patient power of continental drift as the Iapetus Ocean closes and Taconia collides with Laurentia, transforming trilobite-rich limestone into the schists and granites of mountain cores. This is the story of how Earth's greatest construction projects unfold over millions of years, creating the pillars of stone that would support countless future ecosystems.

long_format.name: Sunday Sleep Journeys
long_format.description: Full-length explorations designed for complete nights (60-90 minutes)

catastrophe.name: Wednesday Catastrophes
catastrophe.description: Transform Earth's most dramatic moments into peaceful meditations (30-60 minutes)

ancient_lives.name: Friday Ancient Lives
ancient_lives.description: Walk in ancient footsteps through their senses (45-75 minutes)

metadata.podcast_description: Journey through Earth's deepest memories with The Chrononaut. Transform catastrophes into calm, experience ancient lives, and drift to sleep with stories from deep time.
